column4: is there someone who can tell is it possible to run ubuntu with
no.  Why would you want to do that anyway?
because it's meant for specific kernel versions, 2.6.15 in dapper, 2.4.something in breezy, etc.  Why are you interested in getting it to work on 1.0?
it is a kind of experiment.
so if I wanted to install 2.6.17 kernel, would not I do that ?

nope.  Well, you could compile it yourself.  If we're being purely experimental, I suppose it may be possible.  I'm not familiar with such older kernels.  I imagine theres a bit of an interface difference, you'd almost certainly need to compile everything
Generally, I am newbie in subject linux. I am only wondering is it possible. I don't really reinstall my kernel or something ever.
No, I can't imagine it would be possible.  Without major rewrites of some stuff

I want to execute something like that http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=217657&highlight=kernel now... and I am wondering is it add some entry in my grub config stuff ( can I use my old kernel automatically) ?
Yes, it should still allow you to boot your old kernel.  I didn't really look closely though.
but, yeah, it won't touch your old ones
ok so it looks quite secure. So, I will try it surely.
so how he knew like linux kernel should have seen?

because he had an idea as to how it should behave, and from that, you can decide how you want it to work.  This is really a better topic for #ubuntu-offtopic though, we can continue there if you still have questions
one doesn't need to see the source / know how something works to be able to mimic it.  Its pretty easy once youre familiar with how it interacts with everything.
